post.summary: Use this endpoint to return a CHAPS payment.
post.description: If you need to return a payment, you should do so by the next working day. The same operating hours apply for CHAPS returns as for regular CHAPS payments. Note that this endpoint only supports returning CHAPS payments made after the Bank of England's RTGS Renewal Programme went live, that is, to all payments made on or after 19 June 2023.

HeadersOpenapi_CorrelationIdentifier.description: A unique identifier generated by ClearBank for the request. It is recommended you store this response header for debugging purposes

ParametersOpenapi_Authorization.name: Authorization
ParametersOpenapi_Authorization.description: Your API token retrieved from the portal

ParametersOpenapi_DigitalSignature.name: DigitalSignature
ParametersOpenapi_DigitalSignature.description: The hash of the request body signed with your private key

ParametersOpenapi_RequestIdentifier.name: X-Request-Id
ParametersOpenapi_RequestIdentifier.description: A unique identifier that provides an idempotency check. This must be unique for any subsequent requests sent for at least 24 hours after the initial request was sent.

ApiHeadersSchema_AuthorizationType.description: Authorization header restricted to Bearer token only

ApiHeadersSchema_DigitalSignatureType.description: The digital signature generated by the API consumer

ApiHeadersSchema_RequestIdentifierType.description: The request identifier supplied by the API consumer

ApiHeadersSchema_CorrelationIdentifierTy.description: A unique identifier generated by ClearBankÂ®

paymentId.description: Payment ID assigned by ClearBank to the inbound payment. This is the same value as the TransactionId in the Transaction Settled webhook.

instructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: The instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

detail.description: A human-readable description of the problem unique to the instance of the problem. The reader must be able to discern the cause of the problem from this information.

instance.description: A URI that uniquely identifies the problem being reported. This value should be consistent and deterministic in order to promote automated processing when read in client software

status.description: The HTTP response code returned by the API. This is returned to allow for processing by distributed software agents and MUST match that reported in the transport layer

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type that should not change between different occurrences of a given problem

type.description: A URI that uniquely identifies the problem type being reported
